title: Chassis ECM - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Chassis ECM Installation - CB7; CM7, CN7, CS7, CT7, CE7
Connect the three electrical connectors to the chassis ECM.
Fit the chassis ECM and its rubber mounting into position on the rear mudguard location tabs.
Locate the electrical connector for the USB charger into the rubber mounting.
Position the right seat hook. Install and tighten the fixing to
Position the left seat hook. Install and tighten the fixing to
Install the front fixings for the grab handle and tighten to
Connect the electrical connector to the USB charger in the phone tray and position the phone tray.
Install the fixings for the phone tray and tighten to
Attach the seat heater electrical connectors to the fir tree clips on the phone tray.
Install the first aid kit or tool kit (if fitted) and the strap.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: CE7; CB7; CT7; CS7; CN7; CM7

body.body: If a replacement chassis ECM is fitted, it must be setup as described in
Chassis ECM Calibration Download Flow Chart

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Fixings
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Tightening Procedures
Connect the three electrical connectors to the chassis ECM.
Chassis ECM rubber mounting
Location tabs
Electrical connectors
Fit the chassis ECM and its rubber mounting into position on the rear mudguard location tabs.
Locate the electrical connector for the USB charger into the rubber mounting.
Grab handle front fixings
Seat hook front fixings
Left seat hook
Right seat hook
USB charger electrical connector
Position the right seat hook. Install and tighten the fixing to
5 Nm
Position the left seat hook. Install and tighten the fixing to
5 Nm
Install the front fixings for the grab handle and tighten to
25 Nm
Connect the electrical connector to the USB charger in the phone tray and position the phone tray.
Install the fixings for the phone tray and tighten to
3 Nm
Attach the seat heater electrical connectors to the fir tree clips on the phone tray.
Install the tool kit tray.
Install the first aid kit or tool kit (if fitted) and the strap.
Perform the following operations:
Battery - Terminal Connect
Rider's Seat - Removal/Installation
Passenger Seat - Removal/Installation
If a replacement chassis ECM is fitted, it must be setup as described in
Chassis ECM Calibration Download Flow Chart
